page.title: 02HAM 1894 - 1985
page.content: A local resident born in Ham in{1894 gave us the following information. There were 80 children in Ham in{ {1900}with very few buildings. There were no shops apart from a draper, a post office and a dairy There were several farms and open spaces. The first trams appeared in{1915}between Richmond and Kingston. There were horse drawn carriages and the milkman called five times a day. The only school was the{Russell School which was at the corner of Petersham Park. The children walked to Richmond for cookery lessons. They celebrated{V.E.Day}by a firework party on the common and street parties.
